title: Sustainable Transportation Systems: Integrating Cycling Infrastructure in Urban Environments
abstract: This research evaluates the role of cycling infrastructure in creating sustainable urban transportation systems. Through case studies of 15 global cities, the study identifies key success factors in reducing carbon emissions while improving mobility for diverse populations.

title: Designing for All: Universal Access in Cycling Infrastructure
abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive framework for evaluating and designing cycling infrastructure that serves riders of all ages, abilities, and backgrounds. We examine how physical design elements can enable or constrain participation in cycling for different demographic groups.
